commit_message:
Move Cinder NFS backend driver config in cinder-volume-nfs element

This change aims at moving out of cinder/cinder-volume elements
the bits needed to configure the Cinder NFS backend driver and
as such add the nfs-client element which is a dependency for the
NFS backend driver.

To configure Cinder with a pre-existing NFS share, one has to add
cinder-volume-nfs to the image elements and populate the Heat
template with the NFS shares list as per README files.

Change-Id: I79725a19fc61946f9b0f92a0b54c9b3a440b247a

commit_message:
Move Cinder NFS backend driver config in cinder-volume-nfs element

This change aims at moving out of cinder/cinder-volume elements
the bits needed to configure the Cinder NFS backend driver and
as such add the nfs-client element which is a dependency for the
NFS backend driver.

To configure Cinder with a pre-existing NFS share, one has to add
cinder-volume-nfs to the image elements and populate the Heat
template with the NFS shares list as per README files.

Change-Id: I79725a19fc61946f9b0f92a0b54c9b3a440b247a

commit_message:
Fix agent.prepare() when agents disabled

When use of murano agent is disabled, an exception is raised in
agent.prepare() because the queue doesn't exist as instance state.
This patch turns prepare() into a no-op when the agent's not being used.

Change-Id: I27934d124a7245d6fea524a511607ec42a04f311
Closes-Bug: 1359817

subject: Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-15 20:48:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages

When a ProcessExecutionError is thrown by processutils.execute(), the
exception may contain information such as password. Upstream
applications that just log the message (as several appear to do) could
inadvertently expose these passwords to a user with read access to the
log files. It is therefore considered prudent to invoke
strutils.mask_password() on the command, stdout and stderr in the
exception. A test case has been added to ensure that all three are
properly masked.

OSSA is aware of this change request.

Change-Id: Ie122db5f19802f519b96ed024ab3f2b5eede3eee
Closes-Bug: #1343604

commit_message:
Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages

When a ProcessExecutionError is thrown by processutils.execute(), the
exception may contain information such as password. Upstream
applications that just log the message (as several appear to do) could
inadvertently expose these passwords to a user with read access to the
log files. It is therefore considered prudent to invoke
strutils.mask_password() on the command, stdout and stderr in the
exception. A test case has been added to ensure that all three are
properly masked.

OSSA is aware of this change request.

Originally-Submitted-In: I173dfb865e84eb7dee54a22c76db1e4f125a0a8a

Change-Id: Ie122db5f19802f519b96ed024ab3f2b5eede3eee
Closes-Bug: #1343604

commit_message:
Fixes hyper-v volume attach when host is AD member

The domain name gets added to the initiator name used by the host
if it's an Active Directory member.

Currently the method which gets the initiator name does not take
this into account when retrieving the default initiator name.

Trying to use a wrong initiator name will lead to an exception when
trying to log in to the according iSCSI target.

This patch simply appends the domain name (when the host is an AD
member) to the initiator name used to log in to iSCSI targets.

Closes-Bug: #1328870
(cherry-picked from commit 0d9419f2b36561bf50bbe0f720c8dd8ad4e96660)

Change-Id: Ifbe762c685e46081059a01043431b2c4ac5473fc

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V vm state issue

The method which gets VM related information can fail if the
vm is in an intermediary state such as "Shutting down".
The reason is that some of the Hyper-V specific vm states
are not defined as possible states.

This patch assures that a valid state is always returned by
this method.

Change-Id: I64e95f6b537e83a30dd64474f63f140e0e8e7373
Closes-Bug: #1352428

since commit 1deb31f85a8f5d1e261b2cf1eddc537a5da7f60b.

subject: Improved robustness of devstack install script for snapshot
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-21 16:08:40.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/devstack/lib/congress'], 'message': "Improved robustness of devstack install script for snapshot

Previously, the devstack install script assumed the
directory congress/etc/snapshot existed.  If it didn't,
the install would fail.

This change checks if the directory exists and
proceeds accordingly.

Change-Id: Ia4dfae34f9946f32b5bf8b35afcfbfc935882972
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Improved robustness of devstack install script for snapshot

Previously, the devstack install script assumed the
directory congress/etc/snapshot existed.  If it didn't,
the install would fail.

This change checks if the directory exists and
proceeds accordingly.

Change-Id: Ia4dfae34f9946f32b5bf8b35afcfbfc935882972

commit_message:
Allow using non-default collectors

The local collector is not in DEFAULT_COLLECTORS, but should be usable
explicitly. It, however, suffers from a bug where only
DEFAULT_COLLECTORS are allowed through.

Change-Id: Ia42d1acd39638b448e2e2bfa26aff1c7ae415b71

subject: Remove hardcoded version.
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-19 23:47:57.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': "Remove hardcoded version.

We use semantic versioning, not pbr's pre-version facility. This
line causes local package builds to have the wrong version, and
pbr will in future detect this and error.

Change-Id: Iff26a28a48a7b14df82df06eb102af539c367c39
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove hardcoded version.

We use semantic versioning, not pbr's pre-version facility. This
line causes local package builds to have the wrong version, and
pbr will in future detect this and error.

Change-Id: Iff26a28a48a7b14df82df06eb102af539c367c39

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded version.

We use semantic versioning, not pbr's pre-version facility. This
line causes local package builds to have the wrong version, and
pbr will in future detect this and error.

Change-Id: Ia625d31e87d137e867badcdeac1f33630257bb8c

commit_message:
Disable sshd GSSAPI auth

GSSAPI is not currently implemented in Fuel, so
it only slows incoming SSH connections. Disabling
it will enhance user experience.

Change-Id: I22e808462889a095aa53592d7905279e898006a4
Closes-Bug: #1327988

We don't want to exit if we can't pull a branch reference from one
of the tools repositories, which we do as we are running under set -e

subject: Force heat_local collector on seed first boot
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-04 01:24:53.000000000', 'files': ['elements/seed-stack-config/install.d/01-seed-stack-heat-metadata'], 'message': 'Force heat_local collector on seed first boot

Although is configured on the config.json file to only use heat_local
collector in os-collect-config, this will not be applied until a
first os-apply-config execution, so on the first boot of the seed node
it will try to get the metadata from heat and ec2 and wait to them
to timeout.

Change-Id: I40e6680ef7f69e8f2319caa7e91cef5529cb3741
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Force heat_local collector on seed first boot

Although is configured on the config.json file to only use heat_local
collector in os-collect-config, this will not be applied until a
first os-apply-config execution, so on the first boot of the seed node
it will try to get the metadata from heat and ec2 and wait to them
to timeout.

Change-Id: I40e6680ef7f69e8f2319caa7e91cef5529cb3741

commit_message:
Fixes Nova configuration for utilisation of Qpid for Telemetry

As reported in bug 1331903, without rpc_backend entry, Ceilometer
is unable to collect Qpid statistics. Now fixed for SUSE-based.

Note, this entry should already be put in place as per:
icehouse/install-guide/install/yum/content/nova-compute.html

If this is seen as too much duplication, I'll abandon. However,
without this, things don't work as expected.

Change-Id: Icaf4b3e99c20ddea3edf29dd8888206cb6177c83
Closes-Bug: #1331903

commit_message:
Implement sahara client plugin

Sahara is an integrated project, so python-saharaclient is added
to requirements.txt and saharaclient imports are mandatory.
Also sahara client is added to stevedore configuration.

Change-Id: Ide77975026175dd9d638cb4640925bfd3eade40a
Implements: blueprint sahara-as-heat-resource

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-02 11:03:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'VMware: Create VMwareImage object for image metadata

This change pulls the nested function _get_image_properties() out of
spawn() and puts it in vmware_images.py. It now returns a new
VMwareImage object.

Linked clone logic is moved from a separate function in vmops.py to
the new get_image_properties() function.

Tests have been updated and/or moved as appropriate. No tests have
been removed.

This change has been split out of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/87002/, which was written by Shawn
Hartsock.

', 'number': 13}, {'created': '2014-08-07 13:46:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'VMware: Create VMwareImage object for image metadata

This change pulls the nested function _get_image_properties() out of
spawn() and makes it a factory method for the new VMwareImage object.

Linked clone logic is moved from a separate function in vmops.py to
the new get_image_properties() function.

This has a knock-on effect that vmware.use_linked_clone config option
is now defined and used in driver, and also used vmware_images. driver
has an import chain which imports vmware_images. This creates a
problem using vmware.use_linked_clone as a kwarg default due to the
design of oslo.config. The solution is to ensure driver registers all
its config options before importing any nova modules. An alternative
would have been to move the option to vmware_images, which is its
primary user, and worked around its use in driver. However, this would
have split these config files, and I considered it worse.

vmware_images.get_vmdk_size_and_properties() is no longer used, and is
removed.

Tests have been updated and/or moved as appropriate. No tests have
been removed.

This change has been split out of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/87002/, which was written by Shawn
Hartsock.

commit_message:
VMware: Create VMwareImage object for image metadata

This change pulls the nested function _get_image_properties() out of
spawn() and makes it a factory method for the new VMwareImage object.

Linked clone logic is moved from a separate function in vmops.py to
the new get_image_properties() function.

vmware_images.get_vmdk_size_and_properties() is no longer used, and is
removed.

Tests have been updated and/or moved as appropriate. No tests have
been removed.

This change has been split out of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/87002/, which was written by Shawn
Hartsock.

partial blueprint vmware-spawn-refactor

Co-authored-by: Shawn Hartsock <hartsocks@vmware.com>
Change-Id: I580f173da798318d2675c7c70bbdd19b266259f4

[{'created': '2014-08-05 21:52:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'remove tenant-id from uri

Barbican server will be dropping project-id (a.k.a tenant-id)
from its resource API (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/105562/).
Once that happens, the client will be broken. This commit
fixes that by removing all references of tenant-id from the
secret/order resource URIs. Also, for the unauthenticated use
case, the tenant-id is now passed to the server in the request
header as X-Project-Id

commit_message:
remove tenant-id from uri

Barbican server will be dropping project-id (a.k.a tenant-id)
from its resource API (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/105562/).
Once that happens, the client will be broken. This commit
fixes that by removing all references of tenant-id from the
secret/order resource URIs. Also, for the unauthenticated use
case, the tenant-id is now passed to the server in the request
header as X-Project-Id

Patch Set 7:
  Rebased and fixed merge issue

Change-Id: I9961e13194485b7945060b18130b4b5265022367
Implements: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/barbican/+spec/api-remove-uri-tenant-id
CR: #1353101

commit_message:
do_not_merge: use oslo.vmware

(Included here a version of review.openstack.org/70175 to enable the use
of oslo.vmware library. Please direct review efforts for the oslo.vmware
integration to review.openstack.org/70175 instead. Once the latter
merges, this patch can be removed and the patch chain on which this
patch resides can be rebased accordingly)

Change-Id: Ie086597a51bfbed3eddb92922ae147b740c59f94

commit_message:
Add a Congress tutorial for group membership

This tutorial illustrates how to create a Congress monitoring policy that
detects when one Openstack tenant shares a network with another
Openstack tenant, and then flags that sharing as a policy violation.

Change-Id: Idb348ffb0723399c2beca3b8001299a7b6a36e13

commit_message:
Updated berkshelf to 3.1.5

Updated berkshelf from 2.0.18 to 3.1.5 in Gemfile and added supermarket
source to Berksfile. Also removed sysctl from berksfile since it was
already removed from metadata in 7.0.2 and is not needed anymore.

Change-Id: I8bc2164f742df808f4f6b0f13b6bc566fafdbde3
Implements: blueprint update-berkshelf

commit_message:
Fixed return value in row_model's get_items

In the non-standard case, row_model's get_items returns before the
end of the function.  Those return values were lists instead of
the dicts required by a recent change.

This change ensures get_items always returns a dict.

Change-Id: Icd2511fc9d73d00268a44dda38542d02fc60fd97

commit_message:
Should not send replies for cast messages

Cast messages will not contain a msg_id  and we're currently
sending messages to the reply_q with empty msg_id. In order
to fix it we should not send replies if there is no msg_id
in message.

Closes-bug: #1355058
Change-Id: I913bdf58aa258e355c5eb14fe3623b10b2876f65

commit_message:
Use rfc3986 library to validate URL paths and URIs

More work needs to be done in rfc3986 to give the user more control over what
they consider to be a valid URI in the context of RFC 3986. For example, a
previous incarnation of these tests checked that "1" and "abc" were invalid
when according to the RFC they are.

Update the API samples and tests to use valid URIs

DocImpact

Change-Id: I288fbaead64990db1053b7a11e82904611b8498f

commit_message:
Implement methods to modify volume metadata.

There are four methods in nova/volume/cinder.py which are
NotImplemented. They are as follows:
  1. get_volume_metadata
  2. delete_volume_metadata
  3. update_volume_metadata
  4. get_volume_metadata_value
These methods are required in cases where nova needs to modify
a cinder volume's metadata, e.g. attach and detach time. It also
completes the cinder.API class.

Change-Id: I360076ae28db43e661466f556425947813c9040e
Closes-Bug: #1296164

[{'created': '2014-07-30 15:29:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Data Processing post-bootstrap 3 UI fixes

Some of the data processing forms were showing extra fields
that should have been hidden.  That was fixed by using
form-group rather than control-group.  Also, the cancel button
was missing its outline on some of the forms because it was
missing the btn-default class.

Closes-Bug: #1350372

commit_message:
Data Processing post-bootstrap 3 UI fixes

Some of the data processing forms were showing extra fields
that should have been hidden.  That was fixed by using
form-group rather than control-group.  Also, the cancel button
was missing its outline on some of the forms because it was
missing the btn-default class.  Other buttons used to choose
libraries and add configs were also missing btn-default.
* Details pages had a large gap, fixed row-fluid --> col-sm-12
* row-fluid --> row in other places per migration guide
* icon-plus/minus --> glyphicon-plus/minus
* select inputs have now have form-control class
* unnecessary margins deleted for "Remove" buttons
* list-style added for node processes <ul>

Co-Authored-By: Nikita Konovalov <nkonovalov@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I5f988516290c95e6dba663aa58abeb07563c5bb4
Closes-Bug: #1350372
Closes-Bug: #1352590
Closes-Bug: #1352812

commit_message:
Enable several checks and do not check docs/source/conf.py

* E265 block comment should start with '# '
* H302 import only modules

Do not check docs/source/conf.py. The file is imported from the
cookiecutter template.

Documented why checks are ignored and if they should be enabled
in the future.

Change-Id: I367064ecaa6d1fd9d918f7ce003303e2db660647

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-28 03:44:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Keep Migration status in automatic confirm-resize

function in compute/manager.py _poll_unconfirmed_resizes
will translate the migrate status from finished to error
whenever it find a problem , consider following case

1) _poll_unconfirmed_resizes running, it found several migrations to be confirmed
2) user want to delete an instance ,its task state will be changed to DELETING
3) _poll_unconfirmed_resized will found the task state is not None,
it will make the migration error status
4) following code in _delete
if instance.vm_state == vm_states.RESIZED:
self._confirm_resize_on_deleting(context, instance)
will fail because migration status already updated

User is able to do the migration operations when they found erro
so we don't need to handle this kind of error for them

Change-Id: Ia79dd56c9c1fa8add7dc138d838cbfbac4523ac3
Closes-Bug: #1301696

commit_message:
Keep Migration status in automatic confirm-resize

function in compute/manager.py _poll_unconfirmed_resizes
will translate the migrate status from finished to error
whenever finds a problem ,Consider the following case

1) _poll_unconfirmed_resizes runs and founds several migrations to be confirmed
2) user deletes the instance, so its task state will be changed to DELETING
3) _poll_unconfirmed_resizes will find the task state is not None,
it will make the migration error status
4) following code in _delete
if instance.vm_state == vm_states.RESIZED:
self._confirm_resize_on_deleting(context, instance)
will fail because migration status already updated

User is able to do the migration operations when they found error
so we don't need to handle this kind of error for them

Change-Id: Ia79dd56c9c1fa8add7dc138d838cbfbac4523ac3
Closes-Bug: #1301696

commit_message:
Allow selecting the network for doing the ssh with

Previously, nova ssh was searching for network types: public and
private, which seems to be incorrect (fixed and floating seems to be
correct), causing that this command has probably never worked.

This commit fixes the above and adds an option for selecting the network
to use, which is helpful when there are more networks for the VM.

Change-Id: I01ea6cee725c0feaacab60975c3792b0ac1305e9
Closes-Bug: #1227694
Closes-Bug: #1343991

commit_message:
Unbundle all JavaScript libraries from Horizon

Remove all external JS libraries from Horizon, and pull them in as
xstatic packages instead.

Bootstrap, jquery-ui and jquery.bootstrap.wizard will be unbundled in separate
patches, as there are some problems adding them to global-requirements.

Partial-Implements: blueprint remove-javascript-bundling
Change-Id: Icbbcf8e58db2dcce96d187f7307201f728812cd2

Add ensure_package class

of several important libraries and packages that
was not manages by Puppet before.

commit_message:
Fix dvr router getting scheduled on router update

This commit will fix the issue where in DVR mode, router update command
creates router namespaces on nodes, even if there are no VMs hosted on
them for the attached subnet.

Closes-bug: 1353266

Change-Id: I4252515a40eda3ed089be7fdf3fc6910121d2971

revisions:

When using MySQL, the database charset should be utf-8.

And the default charset is latin1, which will cause glance db sync

Conflicts:
	metadata.rb
	spec/database_spec.rb

Closes-bug: #1356887
Change-Id: I50e299410de8068150d1c405994ecb96918fbc7d
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-20 00:27:23.000000000', 'files': ['libraries/database.rb', 'spec/database_spec.rb', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'attributes/database.rb', 'metadata.rb'], 'message': 'Add database charset during create

When using MySQL, the database charset should be utf-8.

And the default charset is latin1, which will cause glance db sync

Change-Id: I50e299410de8068150d1c405994ecb96918fbc7d
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Add database charset during create

When using MySQL, the database charset should be utf-8.

And the default charset is latin1, which will cause glance db sync
failed.

Closes-bug: #1356887
Change-Id: I50e299410de8068150d1c405994ecb96918fbc7d

commit_message:
Fixed oslotest version pin

It turned out that pip is too smart and knows that 1.1.0.0a1 is less
than 1.1.0. We have 1.1.0.0a1 on PyPI for now, so we need to require
that specific version until the final release is available.

Change-Id: I23d85cf1237177561955df05c752871c443e3630

Rename range to avoid shadowing the builtin

This refactor supports a patch I was reviewing [1].  I thought it
better to apply this consistently in this file as a separate refactor
so that that patch could be done cleaner.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100963

subject: Upgrades, fix for repo path for host system upgrader
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}, {'_account_id': 11082, 'name': 'Kamil Sambor', 'email': 'ksambor@redhat.com', 'username': 'ksambor'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-21 09:53:33.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/pre_upgrade_hooks/manager.py', 'fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/pre_upgrade_hooks/from_5_0_1_to_any_fix_host_system_repo.py', 'fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/tests/test_host_system_upgrader.py', 'fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/tests/test_pre_upgrade_hooks.py', 'fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/config.py', 'fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/engines/host_system.py'], 'message': "Upgrades, fix for repo path for host system upgrader

* in 5.0.1 to run host system upgrader
  we used repository which was in upgrade
  tar ball, after upgrade user could delete
  the repo with all temporary data, as
  result user can get broken repository
  which leads to the error during puppet
  run, add hook to fix repo path for 5.0.1
  version
* copy directory with centos repository
  on host system upgrade stage, it helps
  to keep our engines separated from each
  other and user won't have problems with
  removed repository

Closes-bug: #1358686
Change-Id: Iba8897322af471aa9cd0babed4ff18f31ba8ca9d
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Upgrades, fix for repo path for host system upgrader

* in 5.0.1 to run host system upgrader
  we used repository which was in upgrade
  tar ball, after upgrade user could delete
  the repo with all temporary data, as
  result user can get broken repository
  which leads to the error during puppet
  run, add hook to fix repo path for 5.0.1
  version
* copy directory with centos repository
  on host system upgrade stage, it helps
  to keep our engines separated from each
  other and user won't have problems with
  removed repository

Closes-bug: #1358686
Change-Id: Iba8897322af471aa9cd0babed4ff18f31ba8ca9d

commit_message:
Use flavor settings per datastore in int-tests

Reasons:
 - default flavors are not suitable for different datastores,
   such as cassandra.

Changes:
 - parametrizing test_begin.conf to expect flavor refs;

Change-Id: I3d068718a935132ea1637e99468a686ee85422f5
Closes-Bug: #1329310

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-20 02:01:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove hardcoded version.

Generally everything other than the API servers use semantic versioning, not
pbr's pre-version facility. This line causes local package builds to have the
wrong version today, and pbr will in future detect this and error.

Change-Id: Iafd64f79f6c10786db43a7a22beee7b58cd6b78e

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded version

Generally everything other than the API servers use semantic versioning, not
pbr's pre-version facility. This line causes local package builds to have the
wrong version today, and pbr will in future detect this and error.

Change-Id: Iafd64f79f6c10786db43a7a22beee7b58cd6b78e

Commit a507d42cf5d9912c2b3622e84afb8b7d3278595b makes the
doc builds fail on warnings, so people are probably going
to be running 'tox -e docs' more often. To run that you
need the graphviz package from the distro, so add it to
the list of packages needed when setting up a development
environment.

commit_message:
Add graphviz to list of distro packages to install

Commit a507d42cf5d9912c2b3622e84afb8b7d3278595b makes the
doc builds fail on warnings, so people are probably going
to be running 'tox -e docs' more often. To run that you
need the graphviz package from the distro, so add it to
the list of packages needed when setting up a development
environment.

Change-Id: I47ffe63fddfbbd73c3fc698490ad07235caaf459
Closes-Bug: #1356983

commit_message:
Add two system tests for Heat

Now there is only one system test that run OSTF Heat tests on simple cluster with
Neutron GRE.
Test that run tests on simple cluster with Nova network and test that run test
on cluster with HA mode were added. We need to run OSTF tests in different network
configuration because Heat use different templates for them.

Implements blueprint: add-more-heat-system-tests

Change-Id: Id41401be81f198037044b76f6bf9ff0a5e023c67
